headline: Majority of Global Employers Remain Unprepared for Pay Transparency Laws, Aon Finds
summary: Aon plc (NYSE: AON), a leading global professional services firm, shared findings from its 2025 Global Pay Transparency Study, which found that despite growing regulatory pressure and evolving employee expectations, only 19 percent of organizations surveyed globally consider themselves ready for pay transparency. The study captures insights from more than 1,400 organizations and more than 40 countries.

content.title: Majority of Global Employers Remain Unprepared for Pay Transparency Laws, Aon Finds
content.summary: Aon plc (NYSE: AON), a leading global professional services firm, shared findings from its 2025 Global Pay Transparency Study, which found that despite growing regulatory pressure and evolving employee expectations, only 19 percent of organizations surveyed globally consider themselves ready for pay transparency. The study captures insights from more than 1,400 organizations and more than 40 countries.

thumbnail.caption:
Aon plc (NYSE: AON) exists to shape decisions for the better — to protect and enrich the lives of people around the world. Through actionable analytic insight, globally integrated Risk Capital and Human Capital expertise, and locally relevant solutions, our colleagues in over 120 countries provide our clients with the clarity and confidence to make better risk and people decisions that protect and grow their businesses.

 

Follow Aon on LinkedIn, X, Facebook and Instagram. Stay up-to-date by visiting Aon’s newsroom and sign up for news alerts here. (PRNewsfoto/Aon plc)

headline: Looming pay transparency laws could create chaos for multinational companies and only 19% are ready for the new normal
summary: Most employers are falling behind on preparing their workplaces for new regulation in the EU and elsewhere.

content.title: Looming pay transparency laws could create chaos for multinational companies and only 19% are ready for the new normal
content.summary: Most employers are falling behind on preparing their workplaces for new regulation in the EU and elsewhere.

thumbnail.caption: Most employers say they’re not prepared for new regulation coming from the EU and elsewhere, a new report finds.

headline: India plans to tighten oversight of claims portal to curb rising healthcare costs, source says
summary: NEW DELHI (Reuters) -India plans to bring an existing health insurance claims portal under the finance ministry and insurance regulator to curb overcharging by healthcare providers, a government source told Reuters.  Healthcare costs in India are projected to rise by 13% in 2025, exceeding the global average of 10%, and up from 12% recorded a year earlier, according to professional services firm Aon's Global Medical Trend Rates Report.  An analysis by the government and the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) found that hospitals are inflating treatment costs for patients and overcharging those with higher covers, the source said earlier this week.

content.title: India plans to tighten oversight of claims portal to curb rising healthcare costs, source says

headline: ICW Group Named a Ward's 50 Top Performing Property & Casualty Insurance Company for 2025
summary: ICW Group Insurance Companies has again earned a place on the prestigious Ward's 50 list of top-performing property and casualty insurance companies. Marking the 11th consecutive year—and 19th time overall—the company has been honored for outstanding financial strength and long-term performance.

content.title: ICW Group Named a Ward's 50 Top Performing Property & Casualty Insurance Company for 2025

thumbnail.caption: ICW Group is named a Ward’s 50 Top Performing Property & Casualty insurance company for 2025 for the 11th consecutive year, 19th time overall.
